title: Gendered targeting: Do parties tailor their campaign ads to women?
abstract: Are parties communicating differently to women? A growing literature documents gender differences in the political behavior of both voters and politicians. I analyze how parties strategically vary their communication in ads targeting women using a new comprehensive dataset of over 60,000 Facebook and Instagram ads from 151 parties during the 2019 European Parliament election.

title: Parties' issue responsiveness between elections
authors: Cornelius Erfort, Lukas F. Stoetzer, and Heike Klüver
abstract: Are parties responsive to short-term changes in election polls? We address this using the PARTYPRESS Database and supervised ML to measure parties' issue attention. We find little support that losing in the polls leads parties to change their issue attention.

title: Buying Voter Support for Unpopular Policies: Evidence from German Nuclear Power Plants
authors: António Valentim, Heike Klüver and Cornelius Erfort
abstract: How can governments ensure voters' support for unpopular policies? We argue that perceived economic benefits increase support for otherwise unpopular policies. We test our argument by studying the consequences of nuclear power plants on support for the Green Party in Germany.

title: Targeting Voters Online: How Parties' Campaigns Differ
abstract: How do parties target campaign ads online? This paper analyzes how parties target and how they differ using a new dataset matching Facebook Ad Library data with EES survey responses (over 100,000 ads from 148 parties, 2019 EP elections).

title: An Election Forecasting Model for Subnational Elections
authors: Lukas F. Stoetzer, Cornelius Erfort, Hannah Rajski, Thomas Gschwend, Simon Munzert, and Elias Koch
abstract: We present and evaluate Bayesian forecasting models for German state elections from 1990 to 2024. Our forecasts demonstrate high accuracy at lead times of two days, two weeks, and two months.

title: The Zweitstimme Forecast for the German Federal Election 2025: Coalition Majorities and Vacant Districts
authors: Cornelius Erfort, Lukas F. Stoetzer, Thomas Gschwend, Elias Koch, Simon Munzert, and Hannah Rajski
abstract: We provide a forecast for the German Federal Election of 2025, using our forecasting models for national-level party vote shares and district-level outcomes, including coalition majorities and vacant districts under the recent electoral reforms.

title: The PARTYPRESS Database
authors: Cornelius Erfort, Lukas F. Stoetzer, and Heike Klüver
abstract: We present the PARTYPRESS Database: more than 250,000 press releases from 68 parties in 9 European countries, with supervised ML classification into 21 issue categories (2010 onward).
